    Posted Jul 1, 2019 #155

    In reply to dragondevil32:

     If you're in a lost cities world mine up lots of "Terracotta"/Hardened Clay which is what they're made out of. It's not passive, but macerating that and then processing the clay dust is a fine, easy solution.

    Posted Jul 1, 2019 #156

    In reply to dragondevil32:

     cobblegen -> gravel -> sand

    8 sand in an electrolyzer gives 1 silicon dioxide

    3 silicon dioxide in an electrolyzer gives 1 silicon + 2b oxygen.

    Rollback Post to Revision Rollback

    In reply to dragondevil32:

     couple gen > gravel > sand > dust > chemical reactor with water gives you clay > clay dust gives you lithium, aluminium, silicon, and sodium

     Playing version 1.1. Can't make Phosphorous dust via Apatite Ore. I bought Apatite ore from the omnicoin store and made Apatite dust (Gregtech Community Edition). I put 9 of them into the Basic Electrolyzer but it doesn't accept them, they just sit there. The electorlyzer works fine with 7 clay dust for silicon dust, etc.

     

    I ended up electrolyzing Phosphor Dust instead which ended up being the cheaper way to do it anyway.

  • blamm67
    • Join Date: 3/15/2012
    • Posts: 0
    • Member Details
    blamm67
    • View User Profile
    • Send Message
    Posted Jun 22, 2019 #141

    Found a problem crafting the Vertical Digger.

     The recipe in the CraftTweaker script calls for the Gregtech Diamond Drill using these tags: <gregtech:meta_tool:23>.withTag({"GT.ToolStats": {PrimaryMaterial: "diamond"}})

     The id of the drill I crafted in game is <gregtech:meta_tool:23>.withTag({MaxCharge: 100000 as long, "GT.ToolStats": {Material: "diamond"}})

     I think the Material vs PrimaryMaterial difference is preventing CraftTweaker from correctly identifying it. I used the give command to grant myself a drill with the PrimaryMaterial tag, and the recipe worked.

    Last edited by blamm67: Jun 22, 2019
    Rollback Post to Revision Rollback
